title: Sure, here is a reading list of 20 articles up to 2021 that cover topics related to dataset annotation aggregation and interpreting multiple expert annotators
Maximum likelihood estimation of observer error-rates using the EM algorithm
container-title: Journal of the Royal Statistical Society

title: This seminal paper introduces a method for estimating the error rates of different annotators using the EM algorithm
Cheap and fast—but is it good? Evaluating non-expert annotations for natural language tasks
container-title: Proceedings of the 2008 Conference on Empirical Methods in Natural Language Processing

title: This paper evaluates the quality of non-expert annotations and discusses methods for aggregating them
Learning from crowds
container-title: Journal of Machine Learning Research

title: This article presents a probabilistic model for learning from multiple annotators with varying expertise
Get another label? Improving data quality and data mining using multiple, noisy labelers
container-title: Proceedings of the 14th ACM SIGKDD International Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining

title: The authors discuss strategies for improving data quality by aggregating labels from multiple annotators
The multidimensional wisdom of crowds
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: This paper explores the aggregation of annotations in multi-dimensional tasks
Whose vote should count more: Optimal integration of labels from labelers of unknown expertise
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: The authors propose a model for weighting annotators' votes based on their estimated expertise
Quality management on Amazon Mechanical Turk
container-title: Proceedings of the ACM SIGKDD Workshop on Human Computation

title: This paper discusses quality management techniques for crowdsourced annotations
Active learning from multiple noisy labelers with varied costs
container-title: Proceedings of the 2010 IEEE 10th International Conference on Data Mining

title: The authors present an active learning framework that considers the costs and noise levels of different annotators
The social impact of natural language processing
container-title: Proceedings of the 54th Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: This article discusses the ethical implications of NLP, including issues related to annotation and bias
Iterative learning for reliable crowdsourcing systems
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: The paper introduces an iterative algorithm for improving the reliability of crowdsourced annotations
Variational inference for crowdsourcing
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: This work presents a variational inference approach to model the reliability of crowdsourced annotations
Comparing Bayesian models of annotation
container-title: Transactions of the Association for Computational Linguistics

title: The authors compare different Bayesian models for aggregating annotations from multiple annotators
Spectral methods meet EM: A provably optimal algorithm for crowdsourcing
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: This paper combines spectral methods with the EM algorithm for optimal annotation aggregation
Who said what: Modeling individual labelers improves classification
container-title: Proceedings of the AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence

title: The authors propose a model that accounts for individual annotator characteristics to improve classification performance
Deep learning from crowds
container-title: Proceedings of the AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence

title: This paper explores deep learning methods for aggregating annotations from crowds
Reputation-based systems for crowdsourcing
container-title: Proceedings of the IEEE

title: The authors discuss reputation-based systems to improve the quality of crowdsourced annotations
Learning from noisy large-scale datasets with minimal supervision
container-title: Proceedings of the IEEE Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition

title: This paper addresses learning from large-scale datasets with noisy annotations
Stopping criteria for active learning of named entity recognition
container-title: Proceedings of the 22nd International Conference on Computational Linguistics

title: The authors propose stopping criteria for active learning in the context of named entity recognition
Learning from the wisdom of crowds by minimax entropy
container-title: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems

title: This paper introduces a minimax entropy principle for aggregating annotations from crowds
Bayesian classifier combination
container-title: Proceedings of the 15th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Statistics

title: The authors present a Bayesian approach to combining classifiers, which can be applied to aggregating annotations

These articles provide a comprehensive overview of various methods and considerations for aggregating annotations from multiple experts and crowdsourced annotators. They cover statistical models, machine learning approaches, and practical considerations for improving annotation quality
